Text.Value: Nothing to be done about it now, anyway.
I do.
I saw something that reminded me of... well, it's private. But then I felt something rise within me, like my blood was on fire. Then it passed. That's all I know.
This pain of yours - I hope it won't become a hindrance for us.
What just happened?
It felt... oddly familiar. But I don't know why.
Another episode? Why does this keep happening to you?
Are you sure? Looked like magic to me.
Let the matter rest.
I don't know - what more can I say?
It's stopped now, whatever it is. Let's just carry on.
You must know something. Has this happened before?
Leave.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [PN] Shadowheard grimaces in pain as a glow ignites under the skin of her right hand.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheard grimaces in pain as a glow ignites under the skin of her right hand.

Text.Value: I... I don't know exactly. Lady Shar protect me.
I know magic when I see it. This may warrant investigating.
Well, looks can be deceiving.
Perhaps Lady Shar is testing me somehow... perhaps not. I don't know, in short.
Nothing. A trick of the light.

EditorData.logicalname: DOESN'T KNOW SH IS SHAR WORSHIPPER

Text.Value: I'll take you as I find you. Now let the matter rest.
Trick of the light? Don't take me for a fool.
*Shadowheart's attention is fixed upon the contents of an old journal.*
Why does that keep happening to you?
*Shadowheart's attention is fixed on a damaged old statue.*
You already know as much as I do. Best ignore it, as long as it doesn't hamper us too much.
You can't ignore raw magic - it's like turning your back on a wild beast. Tell me.
Something stirs in your blood - something magical. Tell me.
We both know that's not true. Something stirred up magic within you. What was it?
I saw something that reminded me of my faith... my mission. I felt something rise within me, like my blood was on fire. Then it passed. That's all I know.
We... we should keep moving.
Maybe... it felt oddly familiar, but I don't know why...
If I knew, I promise I'd tell you. But I don't. Can we just leave it at that for now, please?
You can't ignore raw magic - it's like turning your back on a wild beast. Tell me.
Something stirs in your blood - something magical. Tell me.
We both know that's not true. Something stirred up magic within you. What was it?
Your guess is as good as mine.
If you say so...
Let's just move along. Time's a rare currency for both of us.

Synopsis:
POST EA DIALOG OF FOR_Village_OM_ShadowHeart_COM
After finding Sharran crown on a skeleton, an old journal speaking of local disappearances or a defiled statue of Selune, Shadowheart recognises that the ruined village of Moonhaven was attacked by Shar worshippers at some point and realises she may have allies nearby. While she's contemplating this, she experiences a flicker of strange magic. Her companions may notice this and ask what's the matter - she can be truthful or not, knowing that leading the party to a Shar stronghold could end in the deaths of some companions.
